etymology.description: Two figures standing side by side -> concept of comparison
etymology.interpretation: The character 比(bǐ, "compare") depicts two human figures standing side by side, illustrating the act of comparing one thing to another. It's a visual representation that captures the idea of juxtaposition and evaluation.

examples.chinese: 他比我跑得快(他比我跑得快)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǐ wǒ pǎo de kuài.
examples.english: He runs faster than I do.

examples.chinese: 这件衣服比那件衣服便宜(這件衣服比那件衣服便宜)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn yīfu bǐ nà jiàn yīfu piányí.
examples.english: This piece of clothing is cheaper than that one.

examples.chinese: 他比我聪明(他比我聰明)，而且比她勤奋(而且比她勤奮)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǐ wǒ cōngmíng, érqiě bǐ tā qínfèn.
examples.english: He is smarter than I am, and also more hardworking than she is.
